concept.title: Components Involved in Integrating Controllers (AWS, OpenStack, etc.)

p.b: This topic is used for sharing parts for the IaaS controller implementations.

section.p: In , customer subscriptions are managed by means of the Subscription service. When a customer creates or terminates creates or terminates creates or terminates creates, modifies, or terminates creates or terminates a subscription for an Amazon EC2 instance in AWS for a virtual system in OpenStack for a VM in vSphere for a virtual machine in Azure, the Subscription service asynchronously triggers the corresponding actions in a ShellAWSOpenStackvSphereAzure through the Asynchronous Provisioning Platform (APP) and the Shell service controllerAWS service controllerOpenStack service controllerVMware service controllerAzure service controller: Scripts are executed in a ShellVirtual servers are created or deleted in AWSVirtual systems are created or deleted in OpenStackVMs are created, modified, or deleted in vSphereThe virtual machine and - if requested - additional resources are created or deleted in Azure.

APP is a framework which provides a provisioning service, an operation service, as well as functions, data persistence, and notification features which are required for integrating applications with in asynchronous mode. The actual communication with the applications is carried out by service controllers. For each application, a specific and dedicated service controller is required. When APP is deployed (oscm-app container), a Shell service controlleran AWS service controlleran OpenStack service controllera VMware service controlleran Azure service controller is also deployed and initialized. It is preconfigured and registered with APP. This service controller can be used for integrating a ShellAWS servicesOpenStack servicesvSphere servicesAzure services with . Refer to the Technology Provider's Guide for details on APP.
